attires.name: Ruqun
attires.description: A type of traditional Chinese clothing primarily for women, which consists of a blouse and a wrap-around skirt. It is a common form of Hanfu.

attires.name: Kun
attires.description: A general term for trousers in Chinese. In a traditional context, these would be loose-fitting trousers worn under a robe or with a jacket.

attires.name: Lotus Shoes
attires.description: Small, delicately embroidered shoes for women with bound feet. This practice is no longer followed, but the shoes are a significant part of Chinese history.
